abstract: Deforms the SceneKit geometry to match the specified face mesh.
overview:
## Discussion

To update a SceneKit model of a face actively tracked in an AR session, call this method in your [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate] object’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate/renderer(_:didUpdate:for:)] callback, passing the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/geometry] property from the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor] object that callback provides.

Alternatively, you can create, configure, and visualize face models independent of an AR session by creating face geometry objects using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceGeometry] [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceGeometry/init(blendShapes:)] initializer and passing them to this method.

# update(from:)

**Instance Method**

Deforms the SceneKit geometry to match the specified face mesh.

## Declaration

```swift
func update(from faceGeometry: ARFaceGeometry)
```

## Parameters

- **faceGeometry**: A coarse mesh representation of a face’s topology, dimensions, and expression.

## Discussion

To update a SceneKit model of a face actively tracked in an AR session, call this method in your [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate] object’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate/renderer(_:didUpdate:for:)] callback, passing the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/geometry] property from the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor] object that callback provides.

Alternatively, you can create, configure, and visualize face models independent of an AR session by creating face geometry objects using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceGeometry] [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceGeometry/init(blendShapes:)] initializer and passing them to this method.
title: update(from:)
